summary: Mild-mannered Norbit (Eddie Murphy) has always had it rough, since the day he was left abandoned at a combination Chinese restaurant and orphanage. Recently forced to marry the shrewish glutton Rasputia, he is at wit's end. Then his childhood sweetheart, Kate (Thandie Newton), moves back to town, and he tries to figure out a way back to his true love.

This one is a movie that the more you watch it the more you get embarrassed about it. The characters are made on an extreme and superficial way, and the main character is the miserable man on earth, his wife is the most stressful creature alive, she is even bigger and meaner than what you may think at the beginning; meanwhile the first love of our protagonist on the other hand is the kindest, beautiful and slim than any character on a comedy movie‚Ä¶ long story short, this is a movie about stereotypes and just a little,  actually almost no deep story or character development, it is just pure dumb situations one after the other. The movie itself it is an example of a type of comedy that it may work, but just for those that are brave enough to handle it until the end.

This film is nothing but trash, from start to finish! The writing, the acting, the jokes and the humor gives me a really bad taste, seriously! When it came out back in 2007, two months after Dreamgirls, I didn't last too long but ten minutes into the film! Honestly, I have to run out of that auditorium and watch another film that was good, because I couldn't take it anymore. When it came to DVD, and guess what? Yep, I have tortured myself through this abomination against humanity! I mean, it... was....... so........flipping....... AWFUL!!!!!!!!!!!!! I wish I could just go back in time and tell EM (Eddie Murphy) not to release this piece of ungodly garbage or better yet, burn it from existence! Because he was nominated for a Best Supporting Actor Oscar by his very great performance in Dreamgirls, but blew his chances because of this foul mess of a film! Do not recommend this film at all!

The cast is amazing, with Terry Crews, Cuba Gooding Jr., Thandie Newton, Katt Williams, and DONT FORGET Eddie Griffin. In my opinion Eddie Murphy was done and dusted after Norbit. This film operates on the principle that vulgarity is automatically funny. Crassness doesn't need a joke attached because it is (in and of itself) the height of hilarity. The very sight of Eddie Murphy simultaneously in drag and a fat suit is supposed to cause viewers to explode into paroxysms of laughter, and is topped only by his appearance in yellow-face as old Mr. Wong. Some of the most egregiously awful jokes fail so badly the first time (broken bed sex, Rasputia crammed into her compact car) that they're brought back for encores. In one way, it's surprising that the movie is so consistently unfunny. This is a movie that even Murphy's most die hard fans should avoid, for others a root canal would be a funnier time spent. (One of the worst comedies ever made).

Norbit sucks on every imaginable level. What has befallen Eddie Murphy? Has he been possessed or brainwashed? Norbit takes the idea behind The Nutty Professor 2 - that Eddie Murphy can play just about every character in the movie - and strips it of all charm and humor. This movie belongs to the much-loved sub-genre of comedies called "unfunny." It's crass, cruel, and borderline offensive, but the laughs that could redeem all of that are missing. Material as bad as the tripe that comprises Norbit can be endured only if there's a payoff. In this case, the point seems to be that some actors will do anything for a buck. Murphy doesn't do any acting in Norbit. This is all shtick - the kind of stuff that might work in a five-minute skit on Saturday Night Live. Norbit is a supersized version of Steve Urkel.  Norbit operates on the principle that vulgarity is automatically funny. Crassness doesn't need a joke attached because it is (in and of itself) the height of hilarity. (Horribly unfunny shlock by Eddie).

I know a lot of people hate this movie and I don't blame them since it can be quite mean-spirited as well as racist. However, Norbit is actually a guilty pleasure of mine. A legitimate guilty pleasure. One of those types of guilty pleasures that has a lower score than 5.0 on IMDb. I laughed my ass off throughout, the artificial obesity created for Eddie Murphy when pretending to be a fatass woman is quite convincing and much like in Coming to America the filmmakers do a good job of doing the Back to the Future II thing where the same actor plays two characters in the same scene without having to focus the camera on one person at a time and then editing them together. I really believed that a fat woman jumped on her husband to have sex. No sarcasm, there. It doesn't look like awkward green screen. While it is forgettable and occasionally racist, I still think that Norbit will be seen in a more positive light by fans of Eddie Murphy. This may very well be one of the guiltiest pleasures I have had the guilt of being pleasured by...why did that sound a lot funnier in my head than when I actually typed that in?

Norbit is a comedy/drama genre. it is about a mild-mannered guy, who is married to a giant wild women. after crazy adventures, and a lot of discouraging fights, he tries to call it quits. He meets the women of his dreams again 10 years down the road. the same girl he falls in love with is the same girl that was his best friend in the orphanage that they shared. He schemes to find his way back to her. This movie itself is a hilarious movie but has some bad aspects about it. the movie has a lot of vulgar scenes and a lot of racism. I recommend this movie to kids 18 or an older and an audience that has a since of humor.

One look at the poster tells potential viewers all they need to know about Norbit. It's really no deeper than the image of a large woman suffocating a skinny man. There is a minimalist, generic plot; forgettable and heavily stereotyped characters; a bland script; and boring direction. It definitely has a few moments that work, and it is thanks to those that the film avoids the worst possible rating, but other than a few decent scenes here and there, Norbit is completely forgettable.

Norbit est probablement le film le plus d√©bile de toute la carri√®re d'Eddie Murphy, r√©alis√© par son comp√®re Brian Robbins (un des plus mauvais r√©alisateurs en activit√©) et peupl√© d'acteurs qui en font des caisses, comme Terry Crews, Mighty Rasta, Eddie Griffin, Cuba Gooding ou encore Katt Williams. Il en reste que Norbit est un film affreusement hilarant, qui n'a peur de rien et qui ne recule devant rien. Eddie Murphy y est absolument g√©nial, parvenant √† √™tre aussi dr√¥le en type neuneu, ob√®se mal√©fique et en vieux sage chinois √† l'accent japonais. Tout ceci est tr√®s souvent du mauvais c√¥t√© du bon go√ªt et dure probablement 20 minutes de trop, mais offre une belle alternative √† tout ce qu'Apatow nous sert depuis des ann√©es.

Norbit is hilarious and heartwarming from start to finish. In this movie, Eddie Murphy plays three different characters with three different voices. 

Eddie Murphy plays Norbit who is a married milquetoast and former orphan who only stays and puts up with his mean, self-centered, and extremely obese wife Rasputia and her mean ways since she's the only family that he has. Once Kate returns into his life, however, he hopes to make his feelings for her known. He briefly uses some profanity and he is also the main protagonist of the movie. 

Eddie Murphy also plays Rasputia who is Norbit's mean, self-centered, and extremely obese wife who constantly belittles him and she occasionally gets violent with him. She has an affair with her local aerobics instructor Buster who is played by Marlon Wayans. She uses some profanity and she is also the main antagonist of the movie. 

Eddie Murphy also plays Mr. Wong who is the racist Asian restaurant owner who also runs an orphanage where he raised Norbit and Kate among others.

It just shows that as comedians age, their films get worse and worse. They lose their touch they had 30 some years ago and make this piece of shit we call Norbit, which takes the average Murphy formula of him playing almost every single role in the film by using fatsuits.
I actually didn't watch the full film because it was unbearably unfunny, but what I got from watching the first hour was that Norbit is a geeky man who marries a sassy fat black lady who helped him from bullies in his childhood. The whole film is basically her eating, harassing him, and acting extremely stupid. Somewhere in here, Norbit and his childhood friend try to save the orphanage they grew up in from Terry Crews and his muscle displaying henchmen.
Norbit is an awful film, and just by its first word, it's bad, because I noticed Eddie's "nerdy" voice and hell was unleashed. His new wife is extremely unfunny, as well as all the jokes. Norbit is also extremely boring because its plotline is practically nothing except a "We've got to save the ___" clich√© in a ton of movies. Norbit is one of the worst, possibly the worst, movie of the 2000s.
Rasputia is the most revolting character I've ever seen in my life. This film on,y had a few funny parts, but mainly crude
I liked it. one of my favorites.
From start to finish, hilarious!!
Stupid, unfunny, and lame.

Eddie Murphy returns to playing a bunch of characters. This time, orphan Norbit married his sweetheart by Ring Pop, but she gets taken first and they don't see each other again. Instead, he is left with Rasputia. She treats him terribly and she is generally a terrible person. He eventually meets his original sweetheart and tries to figure out what to do. Norbit really isn't the interesting character here, his wife Rasputia is actually the more interesting character, but it focuses on Norbit instead. Despite that, this just isn't that funny. This doesn't have the fun of earlier Murphy films and just isn't that good.

Ugh, this movie! I still don't know how Eddie Murphy continues to keep his acting career when he's reduced to shit like this! But strangely this is the worst movie starring him. As bad as Meet Dave and A Thousand Words are, at least they're harmless. This movie's depressingly horrible with racial stereotypes, terrible jokes, and a bullshit story!

The characters are unlikable assholes, not even the title character is likable. He's probably the most uninteresting of all since he's been treated like shit and controlled all his life by the people he knows since day one. The only thing I can feel for him is pity. Every other character might as well be either evil or stupid since this movie rarely has a good character or at least one that isn't bland.

I feel dirty of watching this travesty and the film deserved those Golden Raspberry Awards for the things I've mentioned above.. It is one of the worst comedies I've seen in my life and one of the worst movies I've ever seen in my life!
